page.title: 04Landwade Hall Farm, Exning
page.content: The farmer has 2300 acres. He has 320 beef cows altogether. He has 120 breeding cows. The beef herd are {Hereford _ Charolais cross.}He takes the calves away when nine months old and sells them for beef. The beef cows have numbers on their ears to identify them. The dairy herd are {Guernseys.}He has 40 cows altogether. He has 28 cows being milked. They are milked by a milking machine. It goes into a tank with ice round it to keep the milk cool. There is a whizzer to stop it turning into ice. He gets 328 litres a day. He has 7{Murray Grey} cows and 7 horses. There are 5 calves. The youngest is one week old. He feeds them on milk, water and oats. His crops are sugar_beet, kale, barley, wheat, oats, peas, beans and hay.
